blocks.value: Blessed Carlo Acutis was an Italian teenager who used computer programming and the internet to spread devotion to the Eucharist. He is called the 'cyber-apostle' and patron of the internet generation.

Carlo had an intense love for Jesus in the Eucharist, attending daily Mass from age 7. He said, 'The Eucharist is my highway to heaven.' He created a website cataloging Eucharistic miracles from around the world, which has been viewed by millions.

Carlo was diagnosed with leukemia at age 15. He offered his suffering for the Pope and the Church, saying 'I offer all the suffering I will have to suffer for the Lord, for the Pope, and the Church.' He died in 2006 and was beatified in 2020. His body remains incorrupt.
